head.title: Journal of a Passage in a Canoe from Pais Plat in Lake Superior to Portage de l'Isle in River Ouinipique, 1784. - Page #13

body.p: << First Page | < Previous Page | Page #13 of 32 | Next Page > | Last Page >>

td.p: Umfreville, Edward. Journal of a Passage in a Canoe from Pais Plat in Lake Superior to Portage de l'Isle in River Ouinipique, 1784. An electronic transcription. MFTP #0030

div.p: by the bursting of a Gun he had in care.

July 6 Tuesday. From Port. Campion a narrow lac, in wch went to the end 1¼m. on the Rt of wch another lac joins with this, but the neck between them has so many large stones in it that we were oblig'd to discharge & carry over it – then abt 200yds to another narrow neck – from hence Wt3m. to a sloping rocky pt small rocky Is on Rt & sevl small ones & a bay on Lt opposite the end of the Co is a deep narrow bay – then Wt2½m. pass'd a deep bay on Lt – this Co goes to a low rocky pt on Lt – then a narrow Chanl like a Creek ¼m. up wch the Chanl is nearly stopt by high stones above water, men debark'd, & pass'd ye Canoe among the Stones to Port. de la Praline, here the water descends tho' a narrow passage (into another lac) thro' wch we pass'd the empty Canoe, Port. 55yds over a good road – From the end of ye Port. WbS120yds to a pt then – then Wt to a pt 250yds, being the begining of a broad Strait into another lac, a creek being on ye Lt – WbS1½ to a pt havg a bay on ye Lt & sevl small Is on Rt – from this pt turn'd rod SSW2½m. having a small rod Islet of Pine trees on Rt & a bay with larger ones on ye Lt – this brought us to an openg like a Creek, which is soon after closed by rocks & small Stones, the men debarked & pass'd ye Canoe in ye Strait among Stones abt 70yds – then entd a narrow lac SSW¾ to a pt on Lt – SbW¾ to a pt on Lt into a bay – then entd a narrow Channel with large stones at its mouth – went in it ¼m. when it opens wide with Is in it – from the end of 1st Isld to So end of another ¼m. SbW – WSW to a pt 1m. a bay on Lt & 2 small ones on the Rt – then went thro' an a narrow passage into another lac – then rod a point an I. on Lt a bay on Rt WNW¼, lac spacious with many Is – then WbS½ to the North end of ye Id – from hence SW¾ to a pt on Rt – then SW. along ye NW shore with many Ids on Lt 1½ to an opening like a wide Creek, went in it WSW. to ye pt of an Id on ye Rt – then SSW across a bay on Lt 3m. 3 Is on Rt & many on Lt – then SSW¾ to ye pt of an Id on Lt (many Stones lay in the Chanl at the beginning of this Co & a bay on Lt) then SWbW along the No or Rt hand shore 2½m. large Is to ye Lt – went in a Chanl like a bold Riv. (last Co is to a low point of Pine Trees on Lt opposite to this point is a bay & 2 Is – then SWbS½1½ to a pt on Rt – SSW1¼ a Traverse to the pt of an I. on Lt bay & rocky shore on Rt – SW¾ to an openg like a bold Creek, pass'd a small rocky Id & another lays at the entrance of the Strait – in it SW1m. to a pt on Lt a bay on Rt & another on Lt both shores rocky, turn'd rod ye pt & went SE in a Spacious bay ¼m. to a rocky pt – then rod last pt SSW in a Strait ¾m. to a pt on Rt both shores rocky, & a little bay on ye Lt went rod ye pt & then WNW2m. to a rocky pt – then entd a Strait on Lt – went in it Wt to a pt of Pine Trees on Lt 2m. when it opens wide with sevl Id on Rt & one on ye Lt[,] then ¼m. to an inlet between 2 rocks, on the Rt is Port. Islet 40yds good road over a smooth road rock, (another lac immediately joins to this, but it has a descent of abt 2[½] yds, & the Passage between the rocks is abt 4yds over) from the Port. went West ½ to [ye] end of a rocky Id of Pine Trees being a Strait abt 50yds wide, in it WbS1m. to a pt on Rt pass'd 3 openings on Rt & 4 on ye Lt (from the end of this Co the Strait is divided into 2 Channels by an Id) then WbN in a fair Chanl & Regular shores abt 100yd[s] wide to a pt on Rt 2m. at ye end of this Co a bay on ye Lt then turn'd rod ye pt & wen[t] No in a narrow Strait ¼m. to a place where the Chanl is almost choak'd up with stones, the men debark'd & pass'd ye Canoe down it – then turned rod a rocky pt on Lt & came to a discharge call'd discharge d'Orignal ½ unloaded ye Canoe, & then shot the Rapid with the remainder, rapid abt 100yds long, from the bottom of it went Wb[…] ¾ over a small lac to Port d'Orignal 230yds over a good road, carried ye Goods over

td.p:
L E G E N D :
in red , modifications made by the editor(s).
in lavender , modifications made by the assumed author(s).
